page.title: 06HEALTH
page.content: The area is lucky in having a man and wife team of doctors living and working in Campden as well as doctors from outside allowing a wide choice. Those in need of hospital treatment are sent to Stratford or Cheltenham. In the Campden area approximately 30 people need the help of the District Nurse who also has two helpers. This number will increase as time passes because many elderly people do not originate from Campden and have no family nearby to call on in a crisis. The local dentist has a surgery in Campden and he also makes house calls on the elderly and infirm. A weekly surgery is held by a chiropodist who also does housecalls. Those who need psychiatric help are visited and so are those in need of physiotherapy. The local chemist dispenses medicines.
